sense.name: remove dirt, filth or other unwanted substances
sense.examples: The dentist cleaned my teeth. Clean your fingernails before dinner. Top-ten Eco-friendly ways to clean the house. Clean the spots off the rug. He cleaned the wound. She cleans house compulsively as her husband starts to spend more time in pubs.

sense.name: remove all contents or possession from
sense.examples: The boys cleaned the sandwich platters of sandwiches. Having cleaned the pantry bare of cookies, coffee and bread, we headed for the big city. The trees were cleaned of apples by the storm.

sense.name: Deprive wholly of money or valuables, may be in gambling
sense.examples: The other players cleaned him completely.

sense.name: Remove feathers, pits, shells, skin, husks
sense.examples: Clean the grain before milling it. Try to clean the fish as soon as possible after removing it from the water. Clean the turkey by removing the gizzards, neck, etc.

sense.name: VPC/Multiword expression
sense.commentary: Some of these vpc's/mwe's may have the same sense as those listed above - please tag accordingly based on whether or not it's a vpc or not. Includes: clean_house clean_out clean_up
sense.examples: She cleans house every week. The boss cleaned out all the lazy workers. We cleaned out the drawers. The robbers cleaned us out in a few hours. The investor really cleaned up when the stock market went up. Clean up before you go to the party! Clean up your room!
